title: Cell culture details for biosample preparation
description: Cell culture specific parameters and protocols.

description.title: Description
description.description: A short description of the cell culture procedure - eg. Details on culturing a preparation of K562 cells

culture_start_date.title: Culture start date
culture_start_date.description: YYYY-MM-DD format date for most recently thawed cell culture.
culture_start_date.comment: Date can be submitted in as YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSTZD ((TZD is the time zone designator; use Z to express time in UTC or for time expressed in local time add a time zone offset from UTC +HH:MM or -HH:MM).

culture_harvest_date.title: Culture harvest date
culture_harvest_date.description: YYYY-MM-DD format date for the cell culture harvest.
culture_harvest_date.comment: Date can be submitted in as YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSTZD ((TZD is the time zone designator; use Z to express time in UTC or for time expressed in local time add a time zone offset from UTC +HH:MM or -HH:MM).

culture_duration.title: Total Days in Culture
culture_duration.description: Total number of culturing days since receiving original vial, including pyramid stocking and expansion since thawing the working stock, through to harvest date

passage_number.title: Passage Number
passage_number.description: Number of passages since receiving original vial, including pyramid stocking and expansion since thawing the working stock, through to harvest date.

doubling_number.title: Population Doubling Number
doubling_number.description: The number of times the population has doubled since the time of thaw (culture start date) until harvest.
doubling_number.comment: This may be reported in different ways - eg. 1) passage ratio and number of passages or 2) direct cell counts.

doubling_time.title: Population Doubling Time
doubling_time.description: The average time from thaw (culture start date) until harvest it takes for the population to double.
doubling_time.comment: Researchers can record the number of times they split the cells and by what ratio as a simple approximation of doubling time. This is important for some cell lines eg. IMR90 (a mortal line) and HI and H9 human stem cells.

protocols_additional.title: Additional Protocols used in Cell Culture
protocols_additional.description: Protocols describing deviations from 4DN SOPs, including additional culture manipulations eg. stem cell differentiation or cell cycle synchronization if they do not follow recommended 4DN SOPs

authentication_protocols.title: Authentications
authentication_protocols.description: One or more Protocol objects that are linked to authentication images or documents

differentiation_state.title: Differentiation State
differentiation_state.description: For cells that have undergone differentiation a description of the differention state and markers used to determine the state.

morphology_image.title: Morphology Image
morphology_image.description: Photo of Cell Morphology at the time of collection

karyotype.title: Karyotype Description
karyotype.description: Chromosome count and any noted rearrangements or copy number variation

synchronization_stage.title: Synchronization Stage
synchronization_stage.description: If a culture is synchronized the cell cycle stage from which the biosample used in an experiment is prepared

cell_line_lot_number.title: Cell Line Lot
cell_line_lot_number.description: For 4DN Tier2 or unclassified cell lines - a lot number or other information to uniquely identify the source/lot of the cells

follows_sop.title: Follows SOP
follows_sop.description: Flag to indicate if all the 4DN SOPs for the specified cell line was followed - Yes or No
